column4: Effect
Spend an uninterrupted moment to catch your breath. Can't repeat
column10: If using INT: find a strategic safe spot FAIL: there's something wrong with the spot, if using DEX: avoid attention. FAIL: foe moves to a spot where you're disadvantaged
column11: Find a strategic safe spot / avoid attention. | Recover 1d4 Stamina
column12: Find a strategic safe spot / avoid attention. | Recover 1d4 Stamina
column13: There's something wrong with the spot / Foe moves to a position of advantage. | Recover 1 stamina

column4: As long as you’re not cornered or surrounded, escape your foes. Lose (4-SPEED) Stamina
Just a momentary pause and you're back in the action. When you would normally lose a Stamina Point from physical exhaustion, you can choose to put an exhaustion token on this card instead
column12: Recover 1d4 Stamina. | Your foe moves to a position of advantage.
column13: Recover 1 Stamina. | Your foe moves to a position of advantage.

column4: Once per breather, After successfully striking a foe in melee, add a punch, kick, or shove.
column12: Deal 1 fatigue

column4: When you deal fatigue, you may: Turn x FATIGUE into x HARM
Weapon does not use a EQUIP point. This is your weapon. Your weapon is your best friend. It is your life. You master it as you master your life.
Wear armour for 1 fewer EQUIP points
(Only when you've taken BR since your last Breather) | Enter an enraged state. When dealing damage in melee, flip INT. Add fatigue for every ✗ | No GM moves on ✗or
column10: While Enraged, you are nearly non-verbal. You cannot make plans with your allies. Make an INT flip to calm down or wait 60 seconds when combat is over

column4: Consult the spirits that reside within your Signature Weapon, they will give you an insight relating to the current situation, and might ask you some questions in return
column11: The GM will give you good detail
column12: The GM will give you an impression
column13: The GM will give you an impression

column4: When you would normally take physical harm, you can choose to put a harm token on this card instead.
When you would normally lose a Stamina Point from physical exhaustion, you can choose to put an exhaustion token on this card instead
Add magic item’s power to a weapon. The magic item is destroyed. Write the power on the weapon card. The weapon only has 1 charge
add 1 red card on your armour to avoid taking a BR or a WD
+ 1 to Discern Realities during combat
For Parley against a target not significantly bigger than you, flip STR as well as INT. Take the best

Use your weapon to deal extra damage. Use this instead of "And This Is For...". In melee, flip DEX to deal fatigue again on the same foe. Any weapon effects happen as well. After use, flip this card face-down until you next Take A Breather
column12: Deal half your fatigue

column4: Once per breather, Use instead of Scent of Blood. * hit a second target during your attack * deal a wound * disarm your foe | After use, flip this card face-down until you next Take A Breather
column12: Choose 1
column13: Deal 1d4 fatigue to the same foe

column4: Spend a moment to survey a dangerous area. Spend your green tokens 1-for-1 as you walk through the area to ask these questions: * Is there a trap here and if so, what activates it? * What does the trap do when activated? * What else is hidden here? * How can the trap be disabled?
column11: Place 3 green tokens on this card
column12: Place 2 green tokens on this card
column13: Place 1 green token on this card

column4: Unburden someone of something they're carrying
column12: The GM will offer you two options between suspicion, danger, or cost

column4: A "key" is just a little brass stick with some cleverness carved into it. If you've brought your own cleverness, then you only need a stick.
column12: The GM will offer you two options between suspicion, danger, or cost

column4: Attack a surprised or defenseless enemy with a melee weapon. You can choose to deal your fatigue OR flip DEX. Choices: * You don’t get into melee with them * You deal your fatigue +1d6 * You create an advantage, +1 forward to you or an ally acting on it * Reduce their armor by 1 until they repair it
column12: Choose 1

column4: See a foe from an angle they weren’t expecting and say a weakness you observed, when anyone acts on this info, take +1 forward.
column12: success

column4: Spend x Stamina to rush an unsuspecting foe. | Choices: * move past them out of their reach * be at their back * deal fatigue to the foe * perform an UNENCUMBERED move
column12: Choose 1
column13: Choose 1 and the foe manages to deal 1 fatigue to you

column4: Nighttime or indoors, while no foe is bearing down on you, regain 1d4 Stamina when Taking a Breather, without needing to flip. Foes cannot see you until you move

When you’re in too deep and need a way out, name your escape route and flip DEX. | On ✗/✔, you can stay or go, but if you go it costs you: leave something behind or take something with you, the GM will tell you what
column12: see below

column4: Spend one META and describe how the environment or recent events provided a distraction that let you escape the attention of any foes around you

Attack a defenseless or surprised enemy at range. Choose to deal your fatigue or name your target and flip DEX. * Head: choose WD or deal your fatigue (again) * Arms: They drop anything they’re holding * Legs: They’re hobbled and slow moving
column11: Deal your fatigue and choose an option
column12: Choose an option

column4: Put an environmental hazard between you and a foe and goad them to approach
column11: They succumb to the danger and cannot respond to your next action
column12: They succumb to the danger's effects
column13: They see your plan and respond
column14: You succumb to a danger you did not see

column4: While in a pursuit, spend one META and describe one way it is about to change: * we go above * we go below * the air changes * the earth changes * the water changes
When you would lose 1 stamina from mental exhaustion, put 1 EX token on this card instead
Lose 1 charge. * lose 1 charge on all your other magic items * lose all remaining charges on this item * lose a charge on this item permanently
column11: The spell / effect is successfully cast
column12: The spell / effect is cast and choose
column13: The spell / effect is cast, GM chooses
column14: The spell / effect fails. The GM will say how

column4: Take a WD. Until the WD is healed, using magical items does not cost the usual 1 charge (though charges may be lost via other effects)
Use this before using a magical item. Instead of the item losing a charge, you might lose Stamina from mental exhaustion
column12: Lose 1 Stamina

column4: Before losing Stamina or taking Harm, end any ongoing magical effect of your magic item. You can cancel losing 1-3 Stamina points, by losing instead 1-3 charges on the item. To cancel taking a Harm, flip the item card over face-down.
When you Entreat the Blood-Bound, also flip face-up any of your magic items that have been discharged

While you have skin contact with an undepleted magical item, you are attenuated to the universe and have an extra split-second reaction time. Lose 2 fewer Stamina from physical exhaustion when attacked

Discard this card until you rest. Change a magic item’s effect to that of another item’s that you’ve seen. New difficulty is set to the other item’s default. | On ✗✗: An effect of the GM's choice is imbued
column12: New effect imbued, but with permanently 1 less charge
column13: New effect imbued, but with permanently 1 less charge
column14: An effect of the GM’s choice is imbued instead

column4: Cast a spell having the effect of a magic item’s effect you’ve seen before.
column12: Lose 2 Stamina, put this card face-down until you rest
column13: Lose 3 Stamina, put this card face-down until you rest

column4: When you attempt to counter a magical effect that will otherwise affect you, stake one magical item on the defense and flip
column11: The spell is countered and has no effect on you
column12: The spell is countered, the item loses a charge
column13: The spell is countered, the item is depleted

column4: Describe a new source (neither the Blood-Bound nor the Living Light) of magical energy in the universe that rushes into your magical item. Use the item, but ignore its limitations or double its effects. The effects happen no matter what. | On ✗✗: The item is destroyed and you are marked by the new source.
column12: The item is depleted
column13: The item is depleted and you are marked by the new source

column4: Spend 1 META and 1 EQUIP and say what equipment you brought along to aid in the current situation. This can also be done as a flashback to re-flip with one level of advantage.

In a steading, spend 2 META and tell a story with the GM about how you found a teacher who helped you level up in one of your skills. Level up in that skill. | This can also be used to gain new skills. To gain a new skill, the requirements must be met.

At a steading, the GM will tell you who is selling and hand you 4 cards from the Item deck. To keep one of the cards, you must buy or barter. Choose: * Spend 1 WEALTH * Spend 1 META + 1 EQUIP * Spend 1 META + 1 of your Item Cards
